Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.check

Class CommonGetters

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.naturalis.common.check.CommonGetters
  • public class CommonGetters
extends Object
    Defines various commonly used getter-type (no-arg) methods that can be used to retrieve a property of the argument. They are meant to be used in conjunction with the various has(...) methods of the Check class. Each getter is associated with the name of the property it exposes, so you can choose the leanest of the has(...) methods (those that don't let you specify a property name yourself). For example: 

     Check.notNull(stampCollection, "stampCollection").has(size(), greaterThan(), 100);
 // "stampCollection.size must be > 100 (was 22)"

    Most of the getters defined here are plain, unadorned method references. None of them do a preliminary null-check on the argument. They rely upon being embedded within in chain of checks on a Check object, the first of which should be a not-null check.

    NB some getters defined here are actually not no-arg methods on the argument but rather unary operations on it, disguised as a Function so they can be passed in as the first argument to the has (...) methods.

    Author:
    Ayco Holleman
